Reviews.Title: “Fine, although far from Alexander Platz”
Reviews.Author: Alpalhao
Reviews.Content: Located 30 min walk from Alexanderplatz, in quiet area, near a nice park. Tram is the best way to get into city centre and tickets are sold in the hotel and in the tram itself. For this last you need coins. Good rooms, Wifi only free in the lobby, good Sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel though far from Alexanderplatz”
Reviews.Author: vitt71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights on a business trip: decent hotel with adequate rooms and a good service. The Downside: Took the train from the Airport to Alexanderplatz thinking it would be close by … after 15 min of asking around was finally told the hotel is 3 tram stops from the place (have no idea why on earth they would call it “Alexanderplatz”). The Upside: the excellent restaurant which makes one of the best cheeseburgers I have eaten in a while. All in all a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yespaire
Reviews.Content: Good standard but a long walk from alexanderplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms ok, food horrible”
Reviews.Author: traveler069187337
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for a seminar. The staff is nice and there are no complaints. The rooms are clean and spacy, however, in a single rooom, you fin only a small and a somwhat bigger towel ....Tissues were empty.... One can live with that but having dinner at the hotels buffet was just horryfying. A very small selection and a very bad quality. The cheapest supermarket salad, brown, was at least 2 days old. Filled cherry tomatos were decomposed and after this, there was no appetite any longer. So if you just want to have a room for the night, o.k., if you want to have food in the hotel - stay away!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: tanagogo1
Reviews.Content: Good central location, helful staff, adequate room, meeting room air conditioning not working, food ik

Reviews.Title: “Easy choice for more demanding company”
Reviews.Author: deadpixel
Reviews.Content: Let's say that we are not the easiest travellers. Kids, dogs - you name it, we got it! Arriving by car is easy, there are fairly good parking facilities and easy access to the hotel from the parking. Very clean rooms as it should be, because the hotel allows pets. Very warm welcome at the reception. Lodging with a fairly sized dog (a Chow Chow) was natural which was not the accustomed practise throughout out little journey around the Europe. Room for 3 persons was quite spacious. It is not at the Alexanderplatz if you are looking for it, but for our travellers location was more than ok. There is quite big park Volkspark Friedrichschain just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad. Not quite Alexanderplatz...”
Reviews.Author: NZEmma
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, large rooms, good facilities, wireless internet in the lobby, bikes for hire from memory, a very good breakfast. But *this is not Alexanderplatz and you will be walking for some time. Nothing major, perhaps a 10 minute tram ride from Alexanderplatz but another hop from the central city. Busy with large groups at times. Can be well priced but worth having a look at other central options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, even more in summer”
Reviews.Author: Virginia-Vegas
Reviews.Content: Nice and quite place. Tram to alexander plaz very close. Rooms and service good. The very best of, terrace for breackfast in summer!! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanchia46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly. The food from their restaurant is great, I had lunch and breakfast there. The lunch was reasonably priced, but breakfast was overpriced in my view at 18 euros although there was one of the widest selections I had ever seen for a hotel breakfast. The rooms were spacious and they left a dressing and slippers for you to use. The room was a little warm, despite opening the windows or using the air con. The hotel sold transportation tickets which was quite useful when you want to get out and about. In terms of location it's about a 3min walk from the tram stop, but it's not in alexanderplatz as the name suggests, it's about 4 tram stops from there. The hotel offers free Internet in lobby areas if you have your own laptop but only for 30mins. If you want to use the Internet in your room or the hotels computers in the lobby you have to pay, which I was disappointed by as im used to getting free internet in my hotel room with other brands. Overall I had a good experience in the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant and inefficient Reception staff and no service”
Reviews.Author: ouragan1
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and regularly to Europe, the Middle East and Asia and stay in 4 and 5-star hotels. I have to admit that I have never experienced such a poor and inefficient service in a hotel that claims to be a 4-star property. I had booked a two-night package that included breakfast, 2 one-day travel card, and a welcome drink. Upon arrival, check-in was expedited but no summary about the package was given to me. It is only when I got to my room and got ready to go to the city center that I realized that something was missing. I went down to reception and I informed a Receptionist that I had not been given the travel cards... I thought it was inappropriate to ask for a so-called "welcome drink" that I have not been served 'til day ! Eventually the receptionist handed over two travel cards without apologizing and without any comment. She only spoke in German to her colleague while attending me. This would have been just a small incident if I had not been through the worst: laundry service. I gave two T-shirts to be washed and ironed on my day of arrival. Although aware that laundry is delivered the same day if handed over before 8:00 am, I picked up the phone and asked for my laundry to be picked up. I was shocked by the answer: "you have to give to reception before 8.00 o'clock". I explained that I was aware of this, adding that I would stay for two nights. I also mentioned that as long as it is delivered the day after, it was fine. The lady repeated that I had to go down to reception the following morning before 8.00 am !!! I am sorry, but this is not the type of sentence any paying guest wishes to hear - especially if you want to sleep some extra hours in the morning! I eventually found a housekeeping supervisor in the corridor ay 1.00 pm and explained to her again that I wanted my laundry bag to be picked up for a delivery the following day in the afternoon; to which she said with a smile "ok, no problem". At 6.00 pm the following day, I decided to call reception and ask about my laundry which had not yet been brought back to my room. The receptionist asked me to hold on, as she was going to inquire. She then told me that my laundry bag was still at reception but my T-shirts had not been washed! She repeated that I had to bring it myself before 8:00 am. She then cut me off justifying herself by saying that the laundry control sheet clearly mentioned that it was to be delivered ... (guess what) ... before 8.00 am. She also mentioned that it was too late now to do anything !!! Extremely upset by her attitude and I immediately went down to reception. I asked to see the General Manager, but she said that the General Manager was not in the house. Upon insisting, she said "we are going to wash your T-shirts. They will dry overnight here and they will be ready before you check out". All in all, 1) no one had informed me about this situation 2) No express solution was offered; i.e. the hotel could have contacted another hotel in the city to have my clothes washed 3) I had no more clean T-shirts for the last evening, 4) I have never been addressed to in this manner by any hotel staff in my life. I am particularly disappointed and appalled for not having been taken seriously. This is totally unacceptable from an international company. It simply disregards the most basic etiquette. I believe the carelessness demonstrated by the staff reflects the level of attention this hotel has for paying GUESTS.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable hotel in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: KazScotland
Reviews.Content: Visited with my partner and we would both recommend it. Rooms were modern, spotless and spacious. Bed was very comfortable and shower was good. Staff very friendly. Didn't eat there so cannot comment on the food. Location-wise, it is about 15 mins walk from Alexanderplatz (or 5 mins on a tram which run very frequently and tram stop was 1 minute from hotel). Not a lot to do where the hotel is located but that is fine as all the sights require transport to get to anyway, we found.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and value hotel”
Reviews.Author: AverageJoeUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a four night break in January 2011 with my partner. The hotel is situated around 15 minutes walk from Alexanderplatz, though is served very frequently by a tram that runs past the hotel. Get off at the second stop from Alexanderplatz, near the small group of off licence. cafe and hairdressers. Once you get the system, it's easy. The hotel sells travel permits for the trams and subway, so once you're there it's no problem getting about. Some reviews here point to an out of town location - it's really not. It's a 4 minute ride to Alexanderplatz and the base of the TV Tower. Hotel itself is good value for Berlin, very clean and comfortable. Staff were very helpful. The only complaint is that breakfast was 18 Euro per person, so we opted not to go for this. I assume the restaurant is of similar high prices. I'd recommend this for a brief tourist stay in Berlin, just ask the staff at the desk to explain the tram system outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, poor location, bad pillows, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Viaticatus
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very nice design, personnel is very attentive and is clean. Nevertheless its not located in Alexanderplatz, nor is it even near. The location of the Hotel is in what used to be the DGR, in East Berlin, amongst the typical communist style precast concrete apartment complexes, in front of a park and a clinic, No small restaurants or small shops nearby, its 2 kilometers from Alexanderplatz. Tiny very thin pillows in a spacious, clean well designed room, very few tv channel options. As a positive we got to see the old communist side first hand.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good location excelent premises”
Reviews.Author: Joseatoro
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a long weekend at this hotel, and it was a very pleasant experience. The hotel has a good location near a tram stop, and close to Alexanderplatz. Very nice rooms and comfortable climate. We ate three times at the restaurant and it was a very nice experience, non-pretentious food and for a competitive price. The staff were great!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but it's not at Alexanderplatz!!!”
Reviews.Author: twyss
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in October. I sat in the bus from Tegel airport to Alexanderplatz and felt lucky that I don't have to change transportation to get to the 'Alexanderplatz' hotel. But when I checked on the map I realized this hotel is about 2 miles away from Alexanderplatz. There were no taxis, so had to walk & take streetcar to get there. My mistake not to check address before but still, the name is misleading. Rooms are confy and have a good size.

Reviews.Title: “As usual for NH a pleasant business hotel, friendly and helpful staff. Price-quality is very good.”
Reviews.Author: abcAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: As usual for NH a pleasant business hotel, friendly and helpful staff. Price-quality is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Great Breakfast. Helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: secundra
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at NH Hotel Alexanderplatz. The room was very clean, quiet and large. There was an extra door between the bedroom and entryway which helped to keep out the hall noise (not that there was much). The bed was very comfortable. The staff were friendly and responsive to my requests (e.g. I asked for an extra bath towel and they left me 4!). The breakfast was great and included any food one could possibly want for breakfast, including several types of eggs, yogurts, fruits, meats, cheeses, danishes, cereals, rolls, smoked salmon, and choices of juices. I liked the location. It was just 4 or 5 tram stops from Alexanderplatz (and the trams ran quite frequently) in a quiet neighborhood across from a beautiful park. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury And Peace”
Reviews.Author: jacquesmolay
Reviews.Content: 21/6/09 My stay at Alexanderplatz, as the hotel is locally known, was tidy, pleasant and relaxing. Like all central city hotels, plan and budget ahead for the stay. The restaurant was very good, but always try to eat out. Restaurants are expensive to operate for hotels, amid the accomodation. Walking out in Berlin, the busy motor vehicular traffic about, reminded me that people try to maintain their existence in quantum mechanical terms by being conveyed thus. I remember telling this to Neils Bohr, here, in 1941 or '42. He stepped into his car and drove away, he was soon arrested.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to Alexanderplatz”
Reviews.Author: Nardolepes
Reviews.Content: I took the metro willing to find the hotel close to Alexanderplatz, but when I was there I realized that the hotel was far away from Alexenderplatz. The room was OK, but the bathroom is like a hospital. The breakfast was good but I find this hotel a little far away from the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great buffet”
Reviews.Author: 808stays
Reviews.Content: my other hotel was overbooked, so i stayed here 1 night. the service was great, but it might have been due to the previously mentioned overbooking at a sister hotel. the rooms were great - clean, comfortable, and quiet. the breakfast buffet was incredible, but expensive. the waitstaff was fantastic and helped map out tourist destinations for me.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Market Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jackanapes
Reviews.Content: Hotel easily accessible from the airport and tram with a tramstop almost outside the hotel. Room were very clean and comfortable but the view from the window was rather disappointing as it was just overgrown wasteland awaiting development. Breakfast was excellent with something to suit everone's taste. The only negative comment I could make would relate to the lack of frendliness and helpfulness shown by the staff. Although check in went very smoothly staff didn't seem to go out of their way to make you feel particularly welcome.

Reviews.Title: “An Above Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kezsin
Reviews.Content: The check-in was efficient, although I must say that the counter personnels could do with a more friendly smile and motivation to serve - especially foreign guests coming out from an almost 24 hour-flight journey. Food selection was good. Drinks were so-so. I loved the German beers on the tap and the loose tea bags that were actually tea leaves. Internet rates were defintely not "at a nominal price" as we were led to believe. But if one thinks that paying 80 Euros for unlimited access is nominal, then I suppose it is all a matter of personal opinion. Rooms were clean though the room sizes were not something you'd talk about. Generally, if you need a place to stay for business or social networking, then this would be it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at All”
Reviews.Author: debg84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon and were pleasantly surprised. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was well equipped and clean. The mini bar was quite impressive too and not too expensive. The first night we were there, we used their restaurant. It was pretty quiet but very plush. The main theme is Spanish food and was one of the most expensive meals we had, but nice all the same. The hotel is a bit out of the way but we managed on the trams, U-bahn and S-bahn quite easily and we felt safe in Berlin (not like Vienna that we went to later!). You can buy day tickets for the hotel for about 6 Euros which we would definitely recommend doing. All in all would definitely recommend but if you want a slightly more central hotel in this chain, there is a NH Freidrichstrasse which is near the main shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and good service”
Reviews.Author: Terence_Hill
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel and would consider it again for our next stay in Berlin. Location: It is not directly at Alexanderplatz as the name indicates but coming from the Hauptbahnhof (main train station) you can take almost any S-Bahn (local train) that stops at Alexanderplatz. From there, you can take the tram M5 or M6 and get out at either "Platz der Vereinten Nationen" or at "Klinikum im Friedrichshain". The hotel lies between these two stations just a few minutes walking distance away. The tram runs until very late in the night. Room: The room is spaceous with a desk and a comfortable chair (see photo). The bathroom was very nice and clean with the usual shampoo, hairdryer etc. that all NH-hotels provide their guests. Service: The staff is very friendly and helpful. You can also buy your ticket for the tram/S-Bahn at the reception. If you need to use the internet, you get a voucher where you get 15 minutes for free. We did not try the breakfast/restaurant or bar. Overall we enjoyed our stay there and would consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Good”
Reviews.Author: McNides
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several NH hotels and have found them to be generally quite good. This one too is perfectly good. Have stayed there twice and each time had a quiet room on the back side. Very clean. Good service. Note that it is a bit further from Alexander Platz than you might at first guess, but taking the tram is easy. Note too that breakfast can be 15 euro in NH hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, the location is a little out of the main area of Berlin but it provides good value considering it has been refurbished. The rooms are large and clean breakfast is great!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: QVQ
Reviews.Content: Part of the NH Hotel chain it is a quality standard hotel with great staff & service, clean rooms & bathrooms. Nothing particularly interesting / special about the hotel itself. The location is fantastic, central to East Berlin a short walk to Hackescher Markt Tram line stops right near the front of the hotel and buses just around the corner. Short tram ride (5 mins) to central Mitte & Prenzlauer Berg.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: pacopadel
Reviews.Content: We went on Easter. We was 4 families with our children. The hotel is good, but undoubtly, the staff at the reception when we arrive on 14th at 4.pm, was incredibly helpful. They gave us all the information, cooperation, and amability that we have never received at any hotel. (And I promise I have travelled a lot in my life). I have problems with my portatil wireless connection, and they connect me. Thank you again. We will come back to this hotel due to their incredible staff.

Reviews.Title: “Style but little substance”
Reviews.Author: Gordon2
Reviews.Content: If you are after a hotel that has no character but is clean and relatively inexpensive, though by no means cheap, then this is the hotel for you. The location is ok but you have to get the ubahn to get anywhere. The nearest station is about a 5-10 minute walk away. There is not one thing that is individual about this hotel. The rooms are relatively large, the bathroom was good but the room had nothing to distinguish it. The walls are very thin which can be an interesting experience. The bar was ok but small and again had no character. The staff were attentive and friendly enough. Did not have food in the hotel as it was not included in our deal, though it seemed expensive in comparison to a number of good restaurants nearby. It seemed like a hotel favoured by business types. If location is all you are after then go for this hotel, but for character, food and a more memorable experience I intend to stay somewhere different when next visiting Berlin. Probably in Prenzlauberg (or however you spell it!) If you stay in the hotel, or indeed in Berlin visit the famous Italian restuarant (it begins with Quo..)just off from the Alexanderplatz - it is truly fantastic and not that expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: londongirl2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the NH Berlin Alexanderplatz for three nights over the August Bank holiday weekend and had paid £46 per night with Expedia. We arrived late on the Friday night and I am not sure if we were upgraded but we were on the 5th floor and our room was a very good size. It had the usual European bed with two single mattresses, a TV unit, a large desk and chair and a arm chair with foot stool. The bathroom was compact with the shower over the bath but was functional. I had some problems with the temperature of the shower going from very hot to very cold however my partner did not have the same trouble. The hotel was in a reasonable location, we walked into the city both days and it took around 20 minutes to get to Alexanderplatz, you could go on one of two trams in 5 minutes but we preferred the exercise. We did not eat in the hotel as breakfast was not included in our room price so cannot advice on that front however they do have a nice wee bar by the reception. The staff were very courteous and happy to help, their english was excellent. All in all a great hotel for the money however some may wish to pay a bit more to get closer to the city, the NH Hotel in Mitte had a fantastic location for those who do not wish to walk or use public transport.

Reviews.Title: “A good value, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HBee
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a great location of a fantastic city. Its location in the old East Berlin was definitely a plus, with its recent history all around. We stayed here for 4 nights in a party of 8, spread over 5 rooms and there were no compaints from anyone. Two of the rooms were upgraded, but all rooms were of a good size, beds and bathrooms were good. The staff were excellent and always helpful. It is a one minute walk to the Hackescher Markt eateries and train station and a 5 minute walk to the Berlin Dom, which is one of the nicest churches I have seen outside Rome. We did two great tours. One, a walking tour of the Third Reich and the other a bike tour of Potsdam. I would love to return to Berlin, and I would definitely stay at the Alexander Platz Hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Berlin Alexanderplatz
HotelInfo.Address: Landsberger Allee 26-32, 10249 Berlin, Germany
